comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content:
Well the cars apparently mean it can't be before 1959.   And the steam train means it can't be later than 1970.   There is a guy with a flag.
I will examine the cars more closely.

comment.author: 23682239@N07
comment._content: The CCC logo on the engine shows it as belonging to the Corrimal Coal and Coke Co., which existed under that name between 1937 and 1964.

comment.author: 59334936@N07
comment._content: Note the VW far left and the business enblazoned on the ute. VWs introduced in 1953 in Melbourne and NSW 1954. Local manufacturing began 1960. The electrical appliance store of Lindsay & Brown still operating today at Figtree.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I had a look for the location on Google earth.   Its not apparent.  There is a guy at railpage australia who would know.  My best guess would be about 1960-61.

comment.author: 25512944@N06
comment._content: I think this is a former crossing of the Princes Hwy at Tarrawanna Rd Corrimal. Looking south with the former Streets Ice Cream Factory the warehouse to the right. Tarrawanna Scrap Metal sign makes sense. FB/EK Holdens suggest 1960/61 maps.google.com.au/maps?q=corrimal+nsw&ll=-34.374955,...

comment.author: 25512944@N06
comment._content: An earlier view of the same crossing, of which I only have the vaguest (post 1965) memories illawarraimages.wollongong.nsw.gov.au/IllaIms/P03/P03588.jpg The shot above is also on the Illawarra images site
